revised_title: Development of a Standard for Measuring Photochemical Illumination
tldr: The authors, Robert W. Bunsen and Henry Enfield Roscoe, develop a method for measuring the chemical action of light using a flame of carbonic oxide gas and a sensitive mixture of chlorine and hydrogen. They establish a standard for comparing the chemical action of light and investigate the chemical action of direct and diffuse sunlight. The authors also introduce the concept of a "chemical unit of light" and explore the chemical brightness of the sky.
